post_text:
In December 2019, the Orleans Parish School Board voted
4-2 against the Superintendent‚Äôs recommendation to revoke Better Choice Foundation‚Äôs charter for Mary D. Coghill Charter School. Despite this vote, Superintendent Lewis has enacted proceedings to take over the school and frozen its budget for next year. On that same day, another 4-2 vote in favor of the Superintendent‚Äôs recommendation was counted while our vote was not. Why has Superintendent Lewis singled Coghill out? Why has the Superintendent exceeded his authority? Check out truthaboutcoghill.com to learn more and like, follow, comment on and share this page and help us get our questions answered and our voices heard!
text:
In December 2019, the Orleans Parish School Board voted
4-2 against the Superintendent‚Äôs recommendation to revoke Better Choice Foundation‚Äôs charter for Mary D. Coghill Charter School. Despite this vote, Superintendent Lewis has enacted proceedings to take over the school and frozen its budget for next year. On that same day, another 4-2 vote in favor of the Superintendent‚Äôs recommendation was counted while our vote was not. Why has Superintendent Lewis singled Coghill out? Why has the Superintendent exceeded his authority? Check out truthaboutcoghill.com to learn more and like, follow, comment on and share this page and help us get our questions answered and our voices heard!

post_text: After uplifting graduation celebrations, we are even more determined to continue our fight! We are committed to advocating, on behalf of our scholars and EVERY child who goes to charter school in Orleans Parish, against the unjust actions of Superintendent Lewis. To learn more about this vital and ongoing issue please visit truthaboutcoghill.com and like, follow, comment on and share this page and help us rally our community!

post_text:
So much love and thanks to our amazing Coghill scholars, staff, parents, and families for coming out in bad weather and tough times for such special graduation celebrations! Many thanks also to Mark Romig and Big Sam for making it such a memorable occasion for our eighth graders and Max Becherer for capturing the joy and excitement for NOLA.com! Check out the pictures and share and comment on this post and keep the much-earned congratulations and cheer coming! #classof2020

post_text: A huge Coghill congratulations to Mr. & Mrs. Sheldon Williams on the arrival of their precious baby girl, Briehanna! Beautiful Briehanna joined the world on May 6, 2020, weighing in at 7lb and 20 inches in height. Both she and mom are doing great! Like/follow our page, share the joy, and welcome the newest member of the Coghill family!

post_text: Join us in honoring our staff of the month for May, Mr. Joshua Moore and Mr. Sheldon Williams! These gentlemen are the backbone of Coghill's educational platform and have built lasting relationships with our scholars and their families. Both have a passion for math and have instilled that same passion in our scholars. These gentlemen are the epitome of John Maxwell's quote "Students don't care how much you know until they know how much you care." Like/follow this page and share this post and help us cheer loud and proud for our #educationheroes #wereign

post_text:
Join us in wrapping up Staff Appreciation Week with a bang! Monumental thanks going out today to Ms. Vannessa Thomas and Mr. Lynarise Elpheage!

Only an exemplary employee inspires her scholars and parents on a daily basis and Ms. Thomas is that employee. Her dedication to her scholars is commendable and we want to thank her for setting such a great standard!

Mr. Elpheage always brings positivity to the workplace and we thank him over and over for being a key member of our staff. His experience brings about a fresh perspective to relationship building and he not only inspires his colleagues but scholars as well.

Like/follow our Facebook page and share this post and your admiration for our #educationheroes #wereign

post_text:
Let‚Äôs showcase more greatness and send a huge ‚Äúyou are the best‚Äù to Ms. Patricia Meiklejohn and Ms. Tasha Johnson!

Ms. Pat is a pleasant beauty inside and out and a phenomenal professional. No matter how big the crowd, a person like her always stands out and she takes the I am out of impossible, by becoming a PRO at tackling the unexpected! Thanks for jumping right in to educate our Kinder babies as if they were your own.

Ms. Johnson is a ray of sunshine with a dynamic personality. Her hard work and excellent performance are an inspiration to all, and Coghill‚Äôs future is sure to be bright with team members like her. Thank you for being your best every day!

Like/follow our Facebook page and share this post and our never-ending gratitude for our #educationheroes #wereign

During Staff Appreciation Week we pay special tribute to Ms. Carol Serio and Ms. Wanda Myers!

Ms. Serio is a huge asset to the SPED department. No matter what is thrown at the department Ms. Serio always tackles the problem with a smile and brings invaluable insight and motivation to the task.

Ms. Myers has the perfect combination of a beautiful personality and an ability and flexibility to service both Coghill‚Äôs scholars and staff. We appreciate Ms. Myers and wish to celebrate her character and the positive effect she has on others.

Like/follow our Facebook page and share this post and your thanks for our #educationheroes #wereign

post_text:
Special Staff Appreciation Week thanks to Mr. Jeffrey Augillard and Ms. Chartrese Smith!

Mr. Jeff is a quiet hero at Coghill. He is always the first to arrive and the last to leave each day and he makes our school sparkle. Mr. Jeff has never met a stranger and befriends everyone he meets!

Ms. Smith‚Äôs attention to detail and determination to see Coghill succeed and grow is a huge asset. Thank you for making a difference and tidying up all the loose ends. A reliable employee is the best gift a leader can ask for and we can‚Äôt thank you enough for being someone we can rely on!

Like/follow this page and help us share our pride in our Coghill family!

post_text: Greetings to our 8th grade scholars in the class of 2020! Coghill Charter School is in the process of ordering your 8th grade graduation cap and gown. We have reached out to our families on several occasions, but we are unable to reach some of our 8th grade graduates. We are in need of your height and approximate weight in order to provide you with a cap and gown. If you have not yet submitted your information or know someone who hasn't, please contact or have them contact Mr. Will Cravens at 504 512 4709 asap. Caps and gowns will be ordered tomorrow morning no later than 10am. Don't be caught without a Coghill 8th grade graduation cap and gown.
text: Greetings to our 8th grade scholars in the class of 2020! Coghill Charter School is in the process of ordering your 8th grade graduation cap and gown. We have reached out to our families on several occasions, but we are unable to reach some of our 8th grade graduates. We are in need of your height and approximate weight in order to provide you with a cap and gown. If you have not yet submitted your information or know someone who hasn't, please contact or have them contact Mr. Will Cravens at 504 512 4709 asap. Caps and gowns will be ordered tomorrow morning no later than 10am. Don't be caught without a Coghill 8th grade graduation cap and gown.

post_text: While we‚Äôre deeply disappointed we won‚Äôt see our scholars again this school year, we will keep moving forward and make sure they get the help they need and the quality education they deserve. Special thanks to our amazing Coghill parents. We are ever energized by your faith and encouragement, and will continue to make sure you and your families are supported and kept informed as our push to save Mary D. Coghill School progresses through the court system. Make sure you visit truthaboutcoghill.com and like, follow and share this Facebook page and spread the word!

post_text:
We are blessed and thankful every day for our Coghill staff! Special shout out to science teacher Ms. Shanwa Washington and art teacher Ms. Helen Ball for their never-ending energy and passion!

Ms. Washington came to Coghill as an inexperienced educator, and within a short time has shown tremendous growth, by being open to feedback and constantly perfecting her craft. Ms. Washington‚Äôs love and compassion for our scholars shines through daily as she takes time out of her busy schedule to work with them after hours.

Ms. Ball is a wonderful instructor with an endless love for art and is always keeping her talented kids engaged. She searches and finds hidden gems within our Coghill student body and calls them every Tuesday and Thursday to check in. She works side-by-side with our scholars via Zoom and Google Chat to ensure they are able to continue to perfect their natural gifts.

Like/follow our page and share this post and help us show some love to our devoted educational leaders! #educationheroes #coghillcares

post_text:
To underscore our commitment to truth and transparency we have developed the website truthaboutcoghill.com. The News vs Truth page specifically addresses inaccuracies in reporting by the media and our fight against the improper actions and overreach by the Superintendent of Schools, Henderson Lewis. We encourage our Coghill community to visit and to share the site so that we may all be better informed. It is our mission to continue to educate and inspire our scholars together!

https://truthaboutcoghill.com/news-versus-truth/
